attributes.additional_details:
A recent report from the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR ) quotes the Government plans to spend £1870 per person in London over the next 5 years whilst over the same period the North East will receive £280 per person. 
Figures for the Midlands and the South West are £193 and £219 per person over the next 5 years. 

References: IPPR, Guardian article by Graeme Wearden 8 Aug 2016.
attributes.background: Spending on infrastructure is heavily biased towards London and the South East.

rejection.details:
Petitions must contain a clear request for action.

If you wanted the Government to equalise per head infrastructure spending across the regions of England (for example) you could start a petition about that.
